document_data.name: Den of the Seven Vales
document_data.staff:
1 bartender
[[Alatelo De Bonito]] (security guard and the financial advisor)
document_data.mainbody: The '''Den of the Seven Vales''' was a [[tavern]], frequented by peasants in the [[Guards District (Athkatla)|Guards District]] of [[Athkatla]]. Owing to the tendency of the original owner, [[Richard]], to hire belly dancers, it was originally called the '''Den of the Seven ''Veils''''', due to the veils worn by such dancers. After he passed away, his wife, [[Patricia]], fired the dancers and renamed the tavern to The Seven ''Vales''.
document_data.Interior: The front bar-room contained a small service table, as well as many other tables and chairs. The back room was unmanned, but was filled with food and bottles of [[wine]]. It was fairly well lit for the societal class it appealed to. The upper floor contained a medium-sized room, containing a few beds and storage chests. Adventuring groups often preferred to stay on this floor.
document_data.Services: The den offered a small, and cheap, selection of brews, including [[Bitter Black]] [[ale]], [[Golden Sands Brews]], [[Dragon's Breath Beer]], and plain old [[mead]]. The main bar was manned by the misandrist bartender, Patricia. She would often refuse to talk to male patrons, and would not give up much information to them. However, she would serve them and put them up for the night.
